title: Grandfather shirt
text:
A grandfather shirt or grandad shirt is a long-sleeved or short-sleeved <a href="flannel">flannel</a> or brushed <a href="cotton">cotton</a> <a href="band%20collar">band collar</a>ed shirt worn throughout <a href="Ireland">Ireland</a>. Traditional shirts are white with coloured vertical stripes. Longer shirts are used as <a href="nightshirt">nightshirt</a>s or <a href="pajamas">pajamas</a>. The nightshirt version can include a matching <a href="Nightcap%20%28garment%29">nightcap</a>. 
The style of shirt (called a "union shirt") was also worn by working-class men in the <a href="United%20Kingdom">United Kingdom</a> during the industrial era. At this period, the lack of a turndown or collar "cape" was filled by the use of a <a href="detachable%20collar">detachable collar</a>. The 2010s decade has also seen the garment feature as a <a href="2010s%20in%20fashion%23Men">mainstream fashion</a> item for men.
The grandfather shirt is also made of <a href="Irish%20linen">Irish linen</a>. The linen version is colloquially known as a 'Sunday shirt'. Sunday shirts are often paired with black trousers or <a href="Irish%20clothing">Irish tweed</a> pants and worn to <a href="Mass%20%28liturgy%29">mass</a>, <a href="Infant%20baptism">christenings</a>, <a href="funerals">funerals</a>, and <a href="weddings">weddings</a>.
In popular culture, a variety of traditional Irish clothing was featured on the BBC series "<a href="Ballykissangel">Ballykissangel</a>" and the Irish folk band, <a href="The%20Clancy%20Brothers%27%20Greatest%20Hits">The Clancy Brothers</a> were often photographed wearing traditional Irish clothes.
A similar collarless shirt or tunic, known as a <a href="kurta">kurta</a>, is traditionally worn in the <a href="Islam">Islam</a>ic world and <a href="South%20Asia">South Asia</a>. This usually has three or four buttons, and is often decorated with intricate <a href="embroidery">embroidery</a>.
